issues.description: The attribute 'numberOfTutors' is declared as type short in the solution but the UML diagram (and problem statement) specifies it as an int. This mismatch will confuse students about the correct type to declare and use throughout the class.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the field declaration in Lecture.java from 'private short numberOfTutors;' to 'private int numberOfTutors;' so it matches the UML and problem specification.

issues.description: The constructor in the solution uses a short parameter for numberOfTutors, but the UML and specification require an int parameter. Students following the UML will implement an int parameter and find the reference solution’s signature incompatible.
issues.suggested_fix: Modify the constructor signature to 'public Lecture(String lectureName, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors)' so that the last parameter is an int.

issues.description: The setter method for numberOfTutors in the solution expects a short argument, but the problem statement (and implied UML) indicates it should accept an int. This mismatch will lead to conflicting setter signatures.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the setter to 'public void setNumberOfTutors(int numberOfTutors)' so it accepts an int parameter, aligning with the UML specification.
